Can we focus on the line in this article that states "landing a rover on Mars is more difficult than a moon landing"?

At first this is a no-brainer. Mars is over a thousand times farther away. On its face a rover Mars landing is more difficult than a rover moon landing.
We and the Russians landed rovers on the moon in the '60's.

But in our language, "moon landing" has come to mean landing humans on the moon.

Landing a remote-controlled skateboard on Mars is zero compared to the complexities of human landing, habitation, and return to earth.
